body.value:
<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="base" id="base" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div type="leaf" n="8" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#f007" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>

                <tei-p data-origname="p">
                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I
                    should tremble now, were his <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> wizard power of gliding through all
                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="base" id="base" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div type="leaf" n="8" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#f007" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>

                <tei-p data-origname="p">
                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I
                    should tremble now, were his <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> wizard power of gliding through all
                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous

                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="base" id="base" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div type="leaf" n="8" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#f007" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>

                <tei-p data-origname="p">
                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I
                    should tremble now, were his <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> wizard power of gliding through all
                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>

               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="base" id="base" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div type="leaf" n="8" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#f007" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>

                <tei-p data-origname="p">
                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I
                    should tremble now, were his <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> wizard power of gliding through all
                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>

<tei-text data-xmlns="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" xml:id="base" id="base" data-origname="text"><tei-body data-origname="body"><tei-div type="leaf" n="8" data-origname="div"><tei-pb facs="#f007" data-origname="pb" data-empty=""></tei-pb>

                <tei-p data-origname="p">
                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I
                    should tremble now, were his <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> wizard power of gliding through all
                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>

               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether

                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>

                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

                    <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> "Methinks I

                    impediments <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in search of me, to place him suddenly before <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> my eyes"
                    How profound, nay appalling, is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the moral evolved by the "Earth's
                    Holocaust"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">;</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">where</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">--</tei-hi> beginning with
                    the hollow follies and <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> affectation<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">s</tei-hi> of the world, -- <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">all vanities and </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">empty</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi"> theories</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">forms,</tei-hi> are<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">one after another, &
                    by an admirably graduated, </tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">growing comprehensiveness</tei-hi>; thrown into the allegorical
                    fire, till, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">at length,</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    nothing is left but the all-<tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>engendering heart of man; which remaining <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    still unconsumed, the great conflagration is <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-ref target="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="ref">naught</tei-ref>
               <tei-note xml:id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" id="note_594af968520b4e46ae42e7fc4ccbe229" data-origname="note">LW has "nought".</tei-note>. <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Of</tei-hi> a piece with
                    this, is the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> "Intelligence Office"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">,</tei-hi> a wondrous
                    symbolizing <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> of <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    the</tei-hi> secret workings in <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">mens' souls.</tei-hi>
               <tei-restore data-origname="restore" data-empty=""></tei-restore> are <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> other sketches, still
                    more charged with <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> ponderous import.<tei-note data-origname="note">It appears that HM initially had
                    a comma, followed by an em-dash, before "The Christmas Banquet," and then rubbed
                    out the dash and comma to render a full stop before adding the bracket to
                    indicate a new paragraph.</tei-note>"The Christmas Banquet"<tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">&</tei-hi> "The <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    Bosom <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Serpent"</tei-hi>
                    would be <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">fine subjects</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    for a curious and elaborate analysis, touching <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the conjectural parts of
                    the mind that produced <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> them. For spite of all the <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">Indian-summer</tei-hi>
                    sunlight <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">on</tei-hi> the <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    hither side of Hawthorne's soul, the other side -- like <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> the dark half of
                    the physical sphere -- is shrouded <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in a blackness, <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">ten times</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">black.</tei-hi>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi" data-empty=""></tei-hi>
               <tei-note data-origname="note">ESM left a blank
                    space and added "ten times" before HM made further revisions to "darker".</tei-note>
                    But this darkness <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> but gives more effect to the evermoving dawn, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    that forever <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">advances</tei-hi>
                    through it, and <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">
                    circumnavigates</tei-hi>
               <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> his world. Whether Hawthorne has simply availed <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
                    himself of this mystical blackness as a means <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb>
               <tei-hi xmlns:tei="http://www.tei-c.org/ns/1.0" rend="bold" data-origname="hi">to</tei-hi> the wondrous
                    effects he makes it to produce <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> in his lights & shades; or whether
                    there really <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> lurks in him, perhaps unknown to himself, <tei-lb data-origname="lb" data-empty=""></tei-lb> a touch of
                    Puritanic gloom,-- this, I cannot</tei-p>
            </tei-div>

            <tei-div type="leaf" n="9" data-origname="div">
                </tei-div></tei-body></tei-text>
